title: 110_hr5906
content: The Act titled "Small Business Capitol Expansion and Improvement Act of 2008" allows for expensing certain real property under section 179F. The taxpayer can elect to treat the cost of qualified real property as an expense not chargeable to capital account, allowing for a deduction in the year the property is placed in service. The aggregate cost for this treatment in a taxable year is limited to $125,000, with adjustments for inflation in subsequent years. The taxpayer can elect to treat the cost of qualified real property as an expense not chargeable to capital account, allowing for a deduction in the year the property is placed in service. The election must be made on the taxpayer's tax return and is irrevocable without the Secretary's consent. Qualified real property refers to section 1250 property with the original use commencing with the taxpayer. If any adjusted amount is not a multiple of $1,000, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $1,000. The taxpayer can elect to treat the cost of qualified real property as an expense not chargeable to capital account, allowing for a deduction in the year the property is placed in service. This applies to section 1250 property with the original use commencing with the taxpayer and meeting the $5,000,000 gross receipts test for the prior taxable year. The taxpayer can elect to treat the cost of qualified real property as an expense not chargeable to capital account, allowing for a deduction in the year the property is placed in service. This applies to section 1250 property with the original use commencing with the taxpayer and meeting the $5,000,000 gross receipts test for the prior taxable year. Additionally, special rules apply for purposes of subparagraph (A) and no deduction is allowed unless the taxpayer files a report with the Secretary containing required information. Conforming amendments are made to section 263(a)(1) to include new subparagraphs. The text discusses amendments to section 312(k)(3)(B) and the table of sections for part VI of subchapter B of chapter 1, specifically adding a new subparagraph (M) for expenditures allowed under section 179F. The amendments made by this section apply to costs paid or incurred after the enactment of this Act.
